title: WSL should allow a symlink to wsl.exe to call the program inside of the default container.
body: A current workaround is wsl-alias, but it'd be nice to allow symlinking on the Windows side from the wsl.exe to, for instance, nano.exe, and use that from the shell as if it's on the Windows side, like running wsl nano %* in a .cmd file.

comments.body: I made a proof of concept utility in Rust. https://github.com/TheGoddessInari/wslwrap
